TopicTitle: How mant times have you crashed

Articles.Content:
ITS A HARD ONE........... how many times have you crashed and/or your game crashed

Edited January 25, 2015 by Tristonwilson12
elevenity billion? I did just crash on the runway due to too much speed, and not paying attention. As for actually numbers I honestly have no idea
I've crashed so many times I've reached the end of the number line.
I try not to crash, but it still happens.

This question was once considered impossible, but officials at the Crash Assessment Facility have finally completed their report, and are ready to announce the total number of cra-

*assistant frantically whispers into ear*

Right.

I've just been informed that the Crash Assessment Facility was hit by a stray rocke- *assistant whispers again* An unknown projectile.

Apologies.
Which one, the game, my crafts or both?

Which one, the game, my crafts or both?

ill take both
Who counts? That's like counting how many times you blink in a day; it's so frequent you'd never know!

Who counts? That's like counting how many times you blink in a day; it's so frequent you'd never know!

I know right.

In terms of crashing my craft, not often unless I'm testing

Game crashing varies from a few minutes to a few hours at times, lost count now though lol
I ran out of fingers and KER doesn't help

I must be in the tiny minority. I've never had KSP crash. Probably because I run 100% stock.

As for how many vehicles I've crashed, I have no idea. My missions usually go as expected, but I have crashed and I haven't kept count. Crashing is expected during my testing/ development. That's why I don't test manned

Best,

-Slashy

Edited January 25, 2015 by GoSlash27

KSP rarely crashes for me. Maybe... once every twenty hours or so? And even then it didn't start happening until I started my resource playthrough, which meant adding Karbonite, KAS, Toolbar, and Scansat to my regular mods.

I've probably had hundreds of ship crashes. Almost all of them Mun landings.

I must be in the tiny minority. I've never had KSP crash. Probably because I run 100% stock.

As for how many vehicles I've crashed, I have no idea. My missions usually go as expected, but I have crashed and I haven't kept count. Crashing is expected during my testing/ development. That's why I don't test manned

Best,

-Slashy

KSP has crashed at least a dozen times for me after 0.25, maybe my computer is terrible, though.

Oh, and 100% stock, too.

I think I've crashed somebody into every planet and moon in the whole system, numerous times, except for Jool and the Sun (but don't quote me on that). And even into an asteroid or three. As for the game, I run stock and can only recall a few crashes, mostly when my obsolete graphics card decides that it has had enough.
I crash often... And when I crash the game crashes.
'Not enough!' he screams while piling on more boosters.

I have a whole album just for my shuttle....

Javascript is disabled. View full album

being insane has its drawbacks

I crash MK3 spaceplanes the most, they usually tear themselves apart on the runway.

My games rarely crash, probably because I am playing on a six year old computer.

I don't crash my craft all that often. Most of my crashes are the result of messing up time warp somehow (sudden unintended decelerations into large bodies at 1000x warp usually results in big bada boom).

Every once in a while I mistime the retrograde burn when landing. Sometimes my craft lands on a hill and falls over, or I didn't position the legs right to keep it stable.

Other than that, I'm fairly decent at keeping spontaneous deconstruction and other mishaps at bay. I credit lots of time playing the trial version.

Game crashes, on the other hand....my folder of game crash logs has 47 sub-folders. I've had the "full" game since Christmas, so that's an average of about 1.5 game crashes per day....and that's not counting the dozen or so crashes that didn't generate a crash log. I don't run any mods, just Engineer Redux.

Wait, you want a number?

Well Crap.

Eh, That's a hard one. Game crashes or craft crashes? Either way, it's...

...I'll say "nÃƒÂ·0". That's right, Error. There is no integer. you can't make sense of how often it occurs.

"How many times have you crashed?'

"Too"

"Two? You've crashed two times?"

"No. Too many times."

Well, let's see. 3.2 years' worth of KSP, playing an average of around 2 hours a day, with an expected crash (game or vessel, take your pick) at least once per hour on average... That's a lot of crashes.

no mods-no crash

that's game crashes
